definition: cage used to hold or transport prisoners
enclosing frame made of bamboo, wire etc/cage/basket/steamer basket/to cover/to cage/to embrace/to manipulate through trickery

sentences.english: Forevermore, I will be the Jailor of the Damned.
sentences.chinese: 從今以後，我將成爲詛咒的囚籠。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, the word slept in it's cage, shedding only silent tears.
sentences.chinese: 這個時候，小字眼還在囚籠裏默默地流淚。

sentences.english: We are born free but in chains everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 我們生來是自由的，但卻處處處於囚籠中。

sentences.english: One day, someone passed the cage and noticed that the word wasn't there anymore.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，有人經過囚籠，發現小字眼不在了。

sentences.english: And she said "we are all just prisoners here of our own device".
sentences.chinese: 她說“我們不過是自己營造的囚籠裏的囚徒罷了”。

definition: out of ammunition and no food left (idiom); in desperate straits
38th parallel, forming the DMZ border between North and South Korea
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
the critical moment/life and death crisis
the few are no match for the many/heavily outnumbered/facing impossible odds (idiom)
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
